question:
Which among the following public service reform of Lord Cornwallis is/ are true?
1. He reduced the number of the officers of the company
2. He hiked the salary of the officers
3. Private trade was strictly prohibited
4. He gave the high-rank post to the Indians
Choose the correct option from the codes given below :
explanation: Lord Cornwallis was aware of the inefficiency and corruptness of the company officers. That is why he reconstructed the company with a reduced number of officers and hiking the salary. He was totally against private trade. He never trusted the Indians so he preferred Europeans (Specially Englishmen) to the high-ranked post of the company.
